ChartInterface.name: ChartInterface
ChartInterface.description:
Sets an interface for adding a link between the chart
and the data accessor.

Uses an event manager for defining different charty events. Since events
need to be present when chart is rendered, for attachment to every SVG node,
they should be defined by draw method. This makes an easy way of propagating
events to each base rendering class.

Note : events are NOT defined in chart init, it can happen that, at this point,
events handler are not yet defined or they don't have all necessary data.
ChartInterface.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

Charty.name: Charty
requires:
chartynames
          scalesfactory
          chartinterface
          datavalidator
          eventfactory
          barchart
          labeledtrianglechart
          linechart
          scatterplot
          donut
          donnutwithinnertext
          linechartcircles
          groupedbarchart
Charty.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

ChartsApi.name: ChartsApi
ChartsApi.description: Api init for chart creation management.
ChartsApi.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

ChartNames.name: ChartNames
ChartNames.description: Define constants that will be used as names for different parts
ChartNames.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

Axis.name: Axis
Axis.description:
Basic Axis representation.

Only one X/Y is sufficient for chart drawing, but can
contain more. The idea is to draw an axis and locate it
wherever is necessary.

Wether Axis is a BaseChart, no need to extend it, since
it will implement all the functions needed.
Axis.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

Bar.name: Bar
Bar.description: Bar drawer. Takes only one data series as input.
Bar.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

HorizontalBar.name: HorizontalBar
HorizontalBar.description:
Bar drawer. Takes only one data series as input.
Extends Bar component, since only merge will be redefined.
HorizontalBar.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

WinLossBar.name: WinLossBar
WinLossBar.description:
Win Loss Bar drawer. Takes only one data series as input.

Win Loss bar data elements allow the following options:

 {
   x: 'Jan',
   y: 200,
   c: 'String',
   reset: false
 }

The reset parameter is a boolean that resets the offset of
  the graph back to 0.
WinLossBar.author: "Cesar Del Soldato <cesards@gmail.com>"

BaseChart.name: BaseChart
BaseChart.description:
Base class for charts
Contains common functionality
BaseChart.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

Line.name: Line
Line.description:
Line drawing.

Note : this charts doesn't take events, as it doesn't seem necessary for now.
Line.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

BaseScale.name: BaseScale
BaseScale.description: Defines common scale functionality. Used as base element for inheritance.
BaseScale.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

PeakValleyLinearScale.name: PeakValleyLinearScale
PeakValleyLinearScale.description: Peak Valley scale for linear axis
PeakValleyLinearScale.author: "Cesar Del Soldato <cesards@gmail.com>"

ScaleFactory.name: ScaleFactory
ScaleFactory.description:
Scale factory. Separation is provived in an attempt to provide an easy way
to switching scales in a defined chart.
ScaleFactory.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

AboveText.name: AboveText
AboveText.description:
Text labeling in the middle the data element with Win Loss offser calculation.
Redefindes "merge"
Useful for vertical bar chart.
AboveText.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

RightText.name: RightText
RightText.description:
Text labeling right to the data element. Redefindes "merge"
Useful for horizonal bar chart
RightText.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

XYAxis.name: XYAxis
XYAxis.description: Base XY system for all the 2D charts.
XYAxis.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

YXYAxis.name: YXYAxis
YXYAxis.description:
Defines a YXY axis system.
Two Y Axis (one left, one right)
One X Axis (bottom).

It is built on top of the XY axis system that is already defined.
YXYAxis.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

BarChart.name: BarChart
BarChart.description:
Create a bar chart that will render
N data series
BarChart.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

DataMapper.name: DataMapper
DataMapper.description:
Maps every data point, taking into account one to many
scales. Works as a scale composite object.

It is possible to requiere more than one scale to map certain
elements, so this component will make the correct positioning.

Each chart will have two mappers : one for horizontal axis and
other for vertical axis.
DataMapper.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

DonutWithInnerText.name: DonutWithInnerText
DonutWithInnerText.description:
Custom donut chart.
Sets a text inside the donut, showing a text label
with the represented value.

So, this representation will get only one value. The
other one must be calculated (rest).

The problem can't be solved using mixins, since the text position
doesn't depend on the data value.
DonutWithInnerText.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

GroupedBarChart.name: GroupedBarChart
GroupedBarChart.description:
Grouped bar chart.
Unlike regular bar char, grouped needs to define
two scales for x axis : one for the axis itself, and
another one for the data mapping.

LineChart.name: LineChart
LineChart.description:
Line chart drawers.
Takes N input data series
LineChart.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

LineChartCircles.name: LineChartCircles
LineChartCircles.description:
Line chart combined with circles. Combines the line chart and
the circle component, defining both as mixins.
LineChartCircles.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

Scatterplot.name: Scatterplot
Scatterplot.description: Scatterplot chart. Defined combining an axis system and a circles mixin.
Scatterplot.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

MultipleDataGroup.name: MultipleDataGroup
MultipleDataGroup.description: Defines a data transformation for composite charts
MultipleDataGroup.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

MultipleInstancesMixin.name: MultipleInstancesMixin
MultipleInstancesMixin.description: Chart that can represent many data series
MultipleInstancesMixin.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

SimpleDataGroup.name: SimpleDataGroup
SimpleDataGroup.description: Defines a basic chart to process individual data series
SimpleDataGroup.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

Accessor.name: Accessor
Accessor.description:
Accessor for data collection

Accessor will iterate over the data collection.
Accessor.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

DataValidator.name: DataValidator
DataValidator.description: Data checker for different data input
DataValidator.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

BootstrapEvent.name: BootstrapEvent
BootstrapEvent.description:
Hooks to specified element a bootstrap feature (for instance, a popover).
Since data will be handled a specific way, a custom bootstrap event is given in
order to facilitate instantiation.

Note : since SVG element won't render contained divs, every element will
be added to the 'body' element. This workaround is easier than dealing with
SVG foreing objects.

Supported bootstrap features : popovers, tooltips.
BootstrapEvent.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

EventManager.name: EventManager
EventManager.description:
Event manager. A simple way of adding multiple events to only one target,
if necessary.

Since d3 works over selections, a "target" will represent an element selection,
so manager won't be working over only one element, but for the collection itself.
EventManager.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

FunctionEvent.name: FunctionEvent
FunctionEvent.description:
When an event occurs, a defined function will be exectuted.
This is for events that don't depende on an specific API.
FunctionEvent.author: "Marcio Caraballo <marcio.caraballososa@gmail.com>"

classitems.description:
Appends a chart to a root d3.selection element. Chart is determined
by a defined chart name.
Margin is used to translate the chart a small distance. A chart can have many
instances.
Whether the chart takes the container dimensions, is it possible to also set
the dimensions as initial options
Defined events will be spread to every chart's component.

options = {
                   chartName : 'BarChart',
                   instances : 2,
                   root : 'body',
                   xAxis : 'ordinal',
                   yAxis : 'linear',
                   xScaleDomain : ['Hi', 'I am', 'a fixed', 'domain']
                 }

classitems.description:

Data probably won't be uniform, so for each data element,
a maximum value is obtained. The maximum element will be kept.
Same situation is for the minimum element

Keeps a reference for the minimum value

data is wrapped by axis ticks.

Calculates the scale domain, based on a data collection and a
callback function
Regarding the data series, ordinal scales should be uniform, whether
they have values for that specific ordinal element or not.

classitems.description: Checks if domain wasn't previously calculated

props.name: niceDomain
props.description: - Beautify the domain to include all the possible values.

classitems.description: Inheritance from LinearScale

Calculates the domain for the peak valley linear scale

The domain is calculated by adding all the data points one by one
and keeping the highest and lowest value it reaches.
It sets the domain and the maximum value.
classitems.name: calculateDomain
